lenders.name: Kristin
lenders.loan_because: As a recent college graduate I don't have a lot of expendable income, but I know an extra $25 here and there (that I would probably spend on something stupid anyway) could be put to much better use by the Kiva loan recipients.  I feel good about helping people help themselves.  By investing in their businesses, these entrepreneurs are investing in their families, local economies, infrastructure and communities. I think the coolest thing is that since most Kiva lenders re-loan the repaid credit, the success of each entrepreneur is passed on to other entrepreneurs around the world.

lenders.name: Novi
lenders.loan_because:
I have a business plan which running in agriculture sector and the specification is "organic fertilizer".
located in Indonesia.
you know, the organic stuff seems getting famous everywhere.
so it's no doubt that this business will be profitable since organic plants need organic fertilizer as well.

as a student, I have to be independent and show to everyone that I can be an entrepreneur.
but  I got stuck in financial capital..
I need about 10,000 $  to begin this business.
for the repayment, I will share the profit and for further requirements it's up to the investor.
the business will be located in highland West Java, Indonesia near my grandmom's house.

I hope you can help me.
thank you.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am a student learning English in my University and I am looking forward to be an entrepreneur but I got stuck in financial capital for this business plan.

hope you can help.

lenders.name: Joe
lenders.loan_because: I have so much money that I figured someone else should have some of it for a while. Plus it makes people work and that makes me smile. Thinking of them sweating away at their little job thingies and I giggle as I sit in my plush recliner in my air conditioned penthouse suite office and sip on lemonade my butler hand squeezed for me. It has a cute little pink umbrella in it too. Naturally the lemons were hand carried in my jet from Florida this morning. And I like the way the ice sounds as it clinks into the fine crystal imported from someone that is probably in need of a loan on kiva. See it all comes back to me anyways.

lenders.name: Mangoong Deng Aguek
lenders.loan_because: I wanted to show up that business is a faction of long and short time throught difference directions of life
lenders.occupational_info:
My work is agriculture , Subject: Financial Assistance
 We invite you all to join us in the development of our region, South Sudan under the guardianship of our respective governments of the Republic of Sudan and Government of south Sudan (Goss).        
  Under the theme: - Working For A New Better Sudan. 
In the course of the last five years, the Goss-the Government of South Sudan maintained a consistence policy of encouraging foreign investments, essential for every business and individual who is in close touch with Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) the incentive embodied in the relevant statutes and to be extremely effective in helping to meet the development needs of the South Sudan region.
This judicious mix of policies has; in fact, enabled the Goss to establish a reputation throughout the Sudan as a premise location for almost any kind of regional and international business according to the recent report released by Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA). 
This is because for people of all Sudan who are carrying heavy burdens’.
 Burden of hopeless, fear, anxiety, weariness, sickness, and poverty or nervous exhaustion, sorrow, or whatever others kind of burden it may be against them for almost 50 years. Lets encourage them to brings the best possible good development of help them to have hopeful for their home land, reconstruction.
Important requirements of (PAPFP) Pinyda Agric-Product and Food Programs, are shaped by its relative lack of manufacturing resources’ and by the world technological needs of its advanced export-oriented industrial economy. In order turn out the countless products that are shipped to virtually every country in the world by South Sudan.
Supplies, vast quantities industrial raw material must uses benefit of the region.
For  a very long time , the region lost its benefit to the animals , birds and other creatures; and traditional work of the people for the land , traditional families of Sudanese in use or planting of  the land with cereal crops , such as sorghum (Dura) , maize, fruits and other different kinds of crops on their small farms. For many years the families do not grow enough food for themselves  ; suddenly the war passed over them for more than 30 years , they died in two pointedly windows; war and hunger ; but now Comprehensive Peace Agreement -CPA ,has just  closed for them one window ;and  remains one , that we are calling all of you to close it. This is because they don’t have agricultural equipment machineries that may pull and clear the surface of the earth. 
Changing the way people farm is one way South Sudan can ends poverty. These years that South Sudan has got chance not to be waste, we all acknowledge that when people are at war, and also at the same time, hunger. Getting food is difficult and to have access to food is the most important thing to everybody. hungry people always have many reasons in the health area, tires easily; so they may not have enough energy to plant more seeds or water their crops; because they depend on traditional farming due to lack of the agricultural equipment machineries, lack of enough food so children are hungry, when children are hungry they don’t have school, they lost up their (eschatological life) future state for new way tomorrow. In fact, the hunger is a problem that must be solved before other cases can be solved. 
South Sudan’s rapid population growth makes it hard to solve the problem of hunger , because most farmers used simple traditional hand tools and farm the same land year after year without the use of fertilizers , lack of skills, experience and machineries , there is limitation for self human energy; limited supply of every needs . In fact it will cost us time, energy, ideological, mentally, financial and education; this shall be final decision to produce enough food and this can be achieved only when agricultural productivity is taken as a priority to benefit throughout four seasons of the year. 
So, Goss and PAPFP are already  working on this possibility ; by last  the few years many  Sudanese organizations would probably go to find out how to solve this case it life is found to be possible ; so , such as mechanized farming means '' the use of modern machinery on farms . On many modern farm the work of laborers’ is done by up - to- date machines, the use of these  help to save a lot of time and labor and brings in big profits .  For instance in modern orchards even the picking of crop or fruits is done by machinery; such as, a tractors with long metal arm drives up to a green cereal or trees and fasten as ripe fruits drop is caught by special device then it is sent along a conveyors belt and packed into large wooden boxes. 
Therefore we are asking your sharing in this co-operation movement for development of food programs in ten states of South Sudan region.
Your Excellency, having said this last and not least, we invite the members of your entire business people to invest in South Sudan and encourage them for development for the people of south Sudan. , 
We have already admitted the lax and fragility of the inexperience which can be corrected by this time. Also we solicit Turkey Embassy, Consulate and Senior Officials  to cooperate with us and offer courses or trainings to some of our staffs in any fields, who could come back and help in development of this nation. 




Therefore,  the followings are Agricultural Equipments our company Request
 Funding for :-
• Primary Tillage Machines for shallow and deep tillage, residue cutting, ploughs and heavy disc harrows
• Agricultural Tractors (5-10) for pulling or pushing agricultural equipments, for plowing, tilling, digging, harrowing and planting. Dumping trucks, excavators, and loaders. 
•  Sowing and planting machines, like grain drilling machine, planters and transplanters.
•  Harvesting machines, like grain harvesting, vegetable harvesting, and root crops harvesting. 
• Chemical spraying machine (mounted sprayers) and trailed sprayers.
• Chemical fertilizing machine, like fertilizer spreader, fertilizer pumps
• Crop drying machine, like grain dryers and tea dryers. 
• Electricity generators
• Water pumping machines.
• Transportation trucks to deliver produces from areas of production to areas of consumption and marketing.


Your kind consideration towards this request would highly be appreciated.

Thanks you so much.
Sincerely yours,

Director General
Mangoong Deng Aguek

lenders.name: UnixGuru
lenders.loan_because:
In Europe we rarely see the poverty that many others around the world can experience on a daily basis.
As a company we try to be as green as possible, and like to give back.
Recently we've started supporting Kiva.Org.
Each month we put more cash into our portfolio and reinvest any returns, to continue to help alleviating poverty.
lenders.occupational_info:
We provide high performance web hosting in 14 European countries, across multiple 10gb backbones using diverse suppliers for high resilience.

lenders.name: RC Limburgerhof/VP
lenders.loan_because: we - the members of the Rotary Club Limburgerhof/Vorderpfalz - find the idea behind Kiva inspiring. Let’s together empower people to make their own business ideas a reality  -- so that their dreams come true. For this reason we decided that each member of our club would support Kiva by making at least one loan.

lenders.loan_because: i want to make model farm of my own for farmers to replicate or an area that will serves as demo farm. I've  been serving voluntarily to help farmers in the remote areas of Compostela Valley Province (COMVAL), Mindanao, Philippines in alternative livelihood to increase their income. upon reflection of the things that i have done, it come to me that it is best if i do it my way and for them to replicate. it could be the best proof and showcase for them also to do the same. what i visualize is to develop a farm with best combination of oil bearing trees (macademia or tamano tree), fruit crops with aquaculture and vegetables. in short the promotion of short, medium and long term crops. in that way the concept of FAITH (food always in the home) will be assured.
lenders.occupational_info: Previously i worked with private institution mostly dealing with community organizing and in institutional building and developing alternative livelihood for farmers. recently i worked with the Government but my vacant time (mostly weekend and holidays)  are devoted to helping farmers, conducting training and lectures on organic farming with them.
